dualCamera
Class DualMoteCamera

java.lang.Object
  dualCamera.DualMoteCamera

public class DualMoteCamera
extends java.lang.Object

This DualMoteCamera class coordinates between two Nintendo Wii Remotes used as IR cameras to find a point in 3D. The motes should be parallel and the distance between the motes can be passed to the constructor. The units the distance in measured in will be the units output for the point. By default, the distance is 2 ft. measured in mm.

Author:
Amy Ciavolino

Field Detail

points_not_found

public int points_not_found
points_not_found counts up the number of points that are missing. It assumes 4 points total.

last_left_point

public XYZ last_left_point
stores what the last points were. Warning: these can be wrong if the last points were wrong. Can also be null

last_right_point

public XYZ last_right_point

latest_distance_between_points

public double latest_distance_between_points
stores the latest distance between and last distance between the two points. if two points arn't found then it doesn't update the last and latest The reason for not updating when points get lost is because it is more useful to know where they were before they were lost. Starts them at 999 to make sure a pinch doesn't get read immediately

last_distance_between_points

public double last_distance_between_points

latestleftpoint

public XYZ latestleftpoint
stores the most recent points. When a new point is found then these are moved to be the last_l/r_point

latestrightpoint

public XYZ latestrightpoint

public int lastleft
last left does not get used.

lastright

public int lastright
Last right stores which of the two points the right camera saw was the one that corresponded to the first point the left camera saw.

otherlastright

public int otherlastright

lastxdis

public double lastxdis

couldbewrong

public boolean couldbewrong
stores if the points might be wrong or not. This can be true when one camera sees two points and the other sees one. It can also happen in a few other scenarios such as when the Wii Remotes are not placed exactly correctly. While this variable is not set correctly in all situations it can still be useful

MIN

The observed minimum value of each coordinate to use for scaling.

The observed maximum value of each coordinate to use for scaling.

The angle between the board and the Wii Remote when it is placed in the angled holder

Method Detail

setUpMotes

public boolean setUpMotes()
Connects the wii remote and sets the lights. Each mote will have 2 LEDs lit. Both motes should have the LEDs on the outside. If the motes are giving negative Z values, the positions need to be switched.

Returns:
If the motes were successfully connected.

disconnectMotes

public void disconnectMotes()
Disconnects the Wii remotes that are connected. All other functions will return null if there are no motes connected.

motesConnected

public boolean motesConnected()
Returns whether there are motes connected.

Returns:
whether there are motes connected.

getLeftMotePoint

public XYZ getLeftMotePoint(int pointIndex)
Returns the raw 2D point from the left camera. Returns null if the index is out of rang or the left mote is not connected.

Parameters:
pointIndex - - The point you want from the camera, from 0 to 3.
Returns:
The X and Y from the camera with the Z value set to 0.

getRightMotePoint

public XYZ getRightMotePoint(int pointIndex)
Returns the raw 2D point from the right camera. Returns null if the index is out of rang or the right mote is not connected.

Parameters:
pointIndex - - The point you want from the camera, from 0 to 3.
Returns:
The X and Y from the camera with the Z value set to 0.

getRealPoints

public XYZ[] getRealPoints()
Returns the actual points in space from the points the camera read. It uses triangulation and figures out which points match up with each other. This method works in all situations except for when the points are near the z axis To clarify if you draw a line between the two points and that line points into a circle between the two wiimotes. The circle has diameter of the wiimotes. The reason for this is that the left most point no longer matches up with the left most point on both cameras. There are also other situations where the points can be calculated wrong such as when the Wii Remotes are not positioned correctly. Nearly all of the problems stem from having to differentiate between two or more points being read by the Wii Remotes. Use XYZPointWindow to get a feel for when it works and when it doesn't.

Returns:
returnthis is an array of size 2 with the 1rst point read by the left camera is in index 0

setXthreshold

public void setXthreshold(int x_thresh)
Sets the duration of movement in the X direction to trigger a swipe. If the swipeSensitivity is set correctly this should not be effected by the units used. Default value is 8 and must be positive if changed.

Parameters:
x_thresh - The duration of movement in the X direction to trigger a swipe.

setYthreshold

public void setYthreshold(int y_thresh)
Sets the duration of movement in the Y direction to trigger a swipe. If the swipeSensitivity is set correctly this should not be effected by the units used. Default value is 8 and must be positive if changed.

Parameters:
y_thresh - The duration of movement in the Y direction to trigger a swipe.

setZthreshold

public void setZthreshold(int z_thresh)
Sets the duration of movement in the Z direction to trigger a swipe. If the swipeSensitivity is set correctly this should not be effected by the units used. Default value is 8 and must be positive if changed.

Parameters:
z_thresh - The duration of movement in the Z direction to trigger a swipe.

setSwipeSensitivity

public void setSwipeSensitivity(int swipeSensitivity)
Sets the sensitivity of the swipe gestures i.e. the speed the point must be moving to activate a swipe. A higher value means the point must move faster. Default value is 2 mm. If different units are used the sensitivity must be set for swipes to work correctly. Sensitivity must be positive.

Parameters:
swipeSensitivity - How fast the point/points must be moved to trigger a swipe.

setPinchThreshold

public void setPinchThreshold(int pinchThreshold)
Sets the distance between points that indicates a pinch is about to be triggered. Default value is 70 mm. If different units are used the pinch threshold must be set for pinching to work correctly. Threshold must be positive.

Parameters:
pinchThreshold - How close the points must be to trigger a pinch.

staticMote1Point

public XYZ staticMote1Point(int pointIndex)
These two methods are used to return static points so that the Wii remotes do not have to be connected. (Just for testing)

staticMote2Point

public XYZ staticMote2Point(int pointIndex)
